intro: Haloragodendron baeuerlenii, commonly known as the Baeuerlen's haloragodendron, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Haloragaceae, which includes aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and small, clustered flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
